snippet: Officials are making plans to lay off workers, shift money and delay contracts if President Obama and Congress fail to make a deal to prevent automatic cuts and tax increases.
abstract: Officials are making plans to lay off workers, shift money and delay contracts if President Obama and Congress fail to make a deal to prevent automatic cuts and tax increases.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — While the Obama administration and Congressional leaders are trying to negotiate a deal to head off billions of dollars in tax increases and automatic spending cuts on Jan. 1, federal agencies are quietly preparing for tighter budgets.

headline.main: Federal Agencies Brace for Possible Cuts
